faqSection.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Renting a Shop in Sector 67 Gurugram
faqSection.description: Get clear detailed answers regarding commercial lease terms maintenance and the unique market conditions of Sector 67.

faqs.question: What is the typical lock-in period for a shop for rent in Sector 67
faqs.answer: The standard commercial lease agreement in Sector 67 Gurugram usually includes a lock-in period ranging from 12 to 36 months depending on the property type the size of the investment required for interior fit-outs and the landlord’s specific terms. A longer lock-in period is often negotiated for larger anchor stores or restaurants to ensure stability. Tenants are typically required to fulfill this period before terminating the lease otherwise penalties may apply. We help negotiate reasonable lock-in terms that protect both your investment and the landlord’s interests.

faqs.question: How are maintenance charges usually calculated for commercial rentals here
faqs.answer: Maintenance charges for shops in organized commercial centers in Sector 67 are usually calculated based on the Super Built-Up Area of the unit expressed as a per-square-foot rate or a fixed monthly charge. These charges cover essential common amenities such as 24/7 security common area lighting elevator operation power backup provision and general complex upkeep. Ensure your lease agreement clearly itemizes what is included in the maintenance fee to avoid unexpected costs.

faqs.question: Are there any restrictions on the type of business I can start in Sector 67 commercial spaces
faqs.answer: While Sector 67 is commercially oriented specific restrictions often depend on the particular complex or building’s bylaws and municipal zoning regulations. For instance heavy manufacturing or businesses generating excessive noise or pollution are typically prohibited. Food businesses require specific NOCs like fire safety and hygiene licenses. We verify the permissible business use for every shop listing ensuring compliance before you finalize your rental agreement.

faqs.question: What documentation is required to finalize a commercial lease agreement in Sector 67
faqs.answer: To finalize renting a shop you will typically need identity proof address proof PAN card GST registration certificate if applicable and your company incorporation documents or proprietorship registration. The landlord will require security deposit payment usually 3 to 6 months' rent and one month's advance rent. A formal Lease Deed must be stamped registered and notarized to ensure legal validity and security for both parties involved.

faqs.question: What are the common security deposit requirements for commercial properties in this area
faqs.answer: Security deposit requirements for a shop for rent in Sector 67 typically range from three to six months of the agreed-upon monthly rent. This amount is held by the landlord as collateral against any damages to the property or failure to pay rent during the lease term. The deposit is refundable usually interest-free upon the successful expiry or termination of the lease after deducting any outstanding dues or repair costs.

faqs.question: Is parking available for commercial tenants and customers in Sector 67
faqs.answer: Most modern commercial complexes and developments in Sector 67 Gurugram offer dedicated basement or surface parking facilities for customers and tenants. Some premium properties may include reserved parking slots for the tenant as part of the rental agreement. Adequate parking is a major advantage in this area ensuring ease of access for customers and contributing significantly to the success of retail operations.

faqs.question: How soon can I take possession after signing the shop rental agreement
faqs.answer: Possession timelines depend on whether the shop is ready-to-move warm shell or bare shell. For ready-to-move units possession can often be granted immediately upon signing the registered lease and transferring the security deposit. For bare shell units where tenant fit-outs are required possession is usually given immediately but the rent commencement date may be deferred to allow a rent-free fit-out period which can last from one to three months.

faqs.question: What is the typical annual rent escalation rate in Sector 67 commercial leases
faqs.answer: The industry standard for annual rent escalation in Sector 67 commercial properties is typically between 5% and 8% per annum. This escalation is usually applied yearly after the completion of the first year of the lease term. However, for long-term leases exceeding five years landlords and tenants may negotiate a lower or phased escalation structure. All terms are clearly defined within the legally binding Lease Deed.

faqs.question: Can I renovate the interior of the rented shop space in Sector 67
faqs.answer: Yes interior fit-outs and renovations are generally permitted but they require written prior consent from the landlord and must adhere to building management guidelines and safety codes. Structural changes are usually strictly prohibited. All non-structural modifications made by the tenant must typically be returned to the original bare shell condition upon lease expiration unless explicitly agreed otherwise by the landlord in writing.

faqs.question: Why should I use a professional real estate agency to find a shop for rent here
faqs.answer: A professional agency provides market expertise access to off-market listings and crucial negotiation support ensuring you secure the best location at the most favorable terms. We handle complex legal documentation verify property titles and ensure transparent dealings saving you significant time and potential legal disputes. Our focus is finding the perfect high-return shop for rent in Sector 67 that aligns perfectly with your business model.
